citations.narrative:
The facility has not documented their required annual reviews of the Contingency Plan. Contingency plans must be in
place and reviewed annually to ensure it adequately addresses the criteria listed in paragraph (a) of this section and is still
relevant to the facility and animals. The plan must provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing,
and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. Correct by 28 July 2025 by reviewing the facility's
contingency plan at least once a year and by maintaining documentation of the review including any updates.

The facility's pest control program is not effectively controlling mammalian pests. There is an accumulation of rodent
droppings along the wall and on some storage surfaces inside the room housing the Eastern Grey Squirrel and two Big
Brown Bats. Pests can post a hazard to the health and wellbeing of the animals by either injuring them, exposing them to
potential diseases and illness, or contaminating their food. Correct by 21 July 2025 by establishing and maintaining a safe
and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
